intro: Appendicula uncata subsp. uncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved appendicula, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
